Package pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This abstract super class defines common methods that all the pieces on the chess board need to implement in order to work.

    This class implements the Serializable interface that is used for making deep copies of the board.

    Author:
    Chiraag Rekhari and Jahnavi Bavuluri
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.lang.String color
      Contains the color of the piece -- either white or black.
      java.awt.Point location
      Contains the location of the piece on the board as a Point.
      java.lang.String name
      Contains the name of the piece which is used to display on the board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Piece​(java.lang.String color, int x, int y)
      Initializes the color of the pieces, the name of the piece, along with the x and y location of the piece, which is then used to define where a particular piece sits on the chess board.

      Returns the color of the wanted piece.
      abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      Abstract method to be implemented in each sub class of Piece -- returns the valid Points that a piece can move to on the board
      abstract java.lang.String getName()
      Abstract method to be implemented in each sub class of Piece -- returns the name of the Piece

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece​(java.lang.String color,
             int x,
             int y)
        Initializes the color of the pieces, the name of the piece, along with the x and y location of the piece, which is then used to define where a particular piece sits on the chess board.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the piece -- either black or white
        x - the x location of the piece on the board
        y - the y location of the piece on the board

    • Method Detail

      • color

        public java.lang.String color​(Piece p)
        Returns the color of the wanted piece.
        Parameters:
        p - the piece that you want the color of
        Returns:
        the color of the given piece

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Abstract method to be implemented in each sub class of Piece -- returns the name of the Piece
        Returns:
        the name of the Piece to be drawn in the board

      • getMoves

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves​(Board b,
                                                             boolean check)
        Abstract method to be implemented in each sub class of Piece -- returns the valid Points that a piece can move to on the board
        Parameters:
        b - the board that the Piece is on
        check - checks valid Points that does not put own king in check
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Points that the given Piece can move to
